title: Beyond-mean-field analysis of the Townes soliton and its breathing mode
abstract:
By using the Bogoliubov perturbation theory we describe the self-bound ground
state and excited breathing states of $N$ two-dimensional bosons with
zero-range attractive interactions. Our results for the ground state energy
$B_N$ and size $R_N$ improve previously known large-$N$ asymptotes and we
better understand the crossover to the few-body regime. The oscillatory
breathing motion results from the quantum-mechanical breaking of the mean-field
scaling symmetry. The breathing-mode frequency scales as $\Omega\propto
|B_N|/\sqrt{N}$ at large $N$.
